citation.article-title: Psychrotrophic, lactic acid-producing bacteria from anoxic waters in Ace Lake, Antarctica; Carnobacterium funditum sp. nov. and Carnobacterium alterfunditum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Carnobacterium alterfunditum sp. nov.
Carnobacterium alterfunditum (al'ter.fun.di'tum, L. adj. alter - another. L. adj.funditus - from the bottom)
Description is the same as for Carnobacterium funditum except for the following attributes: Cells 1.3 x 2.5-12.5 μm.
Acid is weakly produced from amygdalin, and the spent fermentation broth of PY-amygdalin- 2% NaCl smells similar to the seeds of dried prunes.
No acid from trehalose or mannitol.
Weak acid only from mannose, fructose, salicin, sucrose, and cellobiose.
Growth occurs in media containing 0.1% yeast extract without added sodium salts, and the optimum sodium chloride concentration for growth is about 0.1 M (about 0.6%).
G + C content of the DNA ranges from 33.3 ± 1.3 to 34.4 ± 2.0.
The type strain pf4 (G + C = 33.3 ± 1.3) has been deposited in the DSM and ACAM (DSM 5972 = ACAM 313).
